enabled.comment: With send queuing enabled, all transactional emails will be placed in a queue, and must be flushed. While this is a more performant method, real-time sending is essentially disabled. It is highly recommended to flush this queue using the system cron, or the lowest available interval Magento cron.

For more details, check the Cron Settings section in the Bronto » Advanced tab.

settings.label: Coupon Manager Integration
settings.comment: With the Bronto Coupon Manager, you can easily edit, manage and distribute unique coupon codes via email marketing or SMS messaging for highly targeted, revenue-generating campaigns. Adding your account ID will enable the automatic redemption of coupons in Coupon Manager to report on valuable metrics such as: redemption rate, average redemption time, and revenue/discount per coupon. To learn more, please visit the Bronto AppCenter and contact your account manager.

site_hash.label: Account ID
site_hash.comment: Found in the settings dialog of the Coupon Manager.

apply_coupon.label: Auto-Apply Coupons
apply_coupon.comment: When enabled, coupon codes can be applied to a customer's shopping session with one of two methods. There is a controller that listens to the store front route /apply/coupon/. You can pass the coupon code in the designated Coupon Code Query Parameter, and a redirect URL. For example: the URL {baseUrl}apply/coupon/?{code}={example}&redirect_path=%2Fcheckout%2Fcart will apply coupon {example} to the customer's shopping session, and redirect them to {baseUrl}checkout/cart/. The second method applies a coupon code by using an observer with Use Event Observer that will scan any store front URL for the Coupon Code Query Parameter. This method is optional, as it can be disabled. If the module is disabled, the controller will still perform redirects, but it will no longer apply coupons.

coupon_code_param.label: Coupon Code Query Parameter
coupon_code_param.comment: The value associated with this key will be the coupon code to be appiled to the shopping cart.

error_message_param.label: Invalid Coupon Query Parameter
error_message_param.comment:
The value associated with this key will cause the corresponding message to be displayed.
Valid values are:
     invalid: The Invalid Message will be used.
     depleted: The Depleted Message will be used.
     expired: The Expired Message will be used.

success_message.label: Success Message
success_message.comment: Displayed when the coupon code in the URL was successfully applied to the session. The coupon code can be replaced in the message dynamically by using the {code} tag.

invalid.label: Invalid Message
invalid.comment: Displayed when the coupon code is not applicable to the customer, does not exist, or if the invalid value is used. The coupon code can be replaced in the message dynamically by using the {code} tag.

depleted.label: Depleted Message
depleted.comment: Displayed when there are no more uses for this coupon code or if the depleted value is used. The coupon code can be replaced in the message by using the {code} tag.

expired.label: Expired Message
expired.comment: Displayed when the coupon code has expired or if the expired value is used. The coupon code can be replaced in the message by using the {code} tag.

conflict.label: Conflict Message
conflict.comment:
Displayed when a coupon code is currently applied in the session and it does not match the coupon code to be applied. There are three tags that can be replaced in the message dynamically:
     {oldCode}: Coupon currently in the session.
     {newCode}: Coupon to be applied to the session.
     {link}: The link to apply the new coupon code.

link.label: Link Text
link.comment:
The link to apply the new coupon code instead, which can only be used by the Conflict Message. Two tags are available for dynamic replacement:
     {oldCode}: Coupon currently in the session.
     {newCode}: Coupon to be applied to the session.

debug.label: Debug

verbose.label: Verbose Log Output

notices.label: Error Notices

format.label: Email Formatting Options
format.comment:
Warning! Changing any formatting options will immediately affect future emails. Make sure your corresponding messages are ready to accept the newly formatted content.

Leave image width or height blank to resize according to aspect ratio. Leave both width and height blank to use the full image size. You can always set width and height values within the HTML of your message too.

default_greeting.label: Default Greeting
default_greeting.comment: If User does not have a Full Name set for their account, this value will be used in the email to populate the %%%%#customerName%%%% API tag.

default_greeting_prefix.label: Default Greeting Prefix
default_greeting_prefix.comment: If User does not have a Prefix set for their account, this value will be used in the email to populate the %%%%#prefix%%%% API tag.

default_greeting_firstname.label: Default Greeting First Name
default_greeting_firstname.comment: If User does not have a First Name set for their account, this value will be used in the email to populate the %%%%#firstName%%%% API tag.

default_greeting_lastname.label: Default Greeting Last Name
default_greeting_lastname.comment: If User does not have a Last Name set for their account, this value will be used in the email to populate the %%%%#lastName%%%% API tag.

use_symbol.label: Include Currency Symbol
use_symbol.comment: Pass Default Display Currency symbol into email (located in "General" > "Currency Setup" > "Default Display Currency").

incl_tax.label: Include Tax in Reminder Emails
incl_tax.comment: If enabled, the %%%%#productPrice_#%%%% for quote items will include the tax (if available) for the given product, subtotal, and grand total.

information.label: Support Information
information.comment:
Most questions can easily be answered by thoroughly reviewing the Bronto Magento Resource Center so please consult that first. The next best resource is the Questions forum where you can post the question if it has not been asked yet.

Disclaimer: The Bronto Extension for Magento was tested in clean Magento environments and Bronto cannot guarantee compatibility with third-party extensions or other site customizations.

If you believe you have encountered an actual issue with the extension itself then you may file a support case. Please note that regular Bronto Support hours are between 8am-8pm ET, Monday through Friday, excluding holidays.

To contact the Bronto Support team, please perform the following steps:
  • Step 1:  Open a case within Bronto. In your case description, please outline the issue and steps to reproduce it. Also, be sure to mention the version of Magento and the version of the Bronto extension currently running.
  • Step 2:  After creating a case, please add a comment and paste in all of the debug information that is generated after clicking the Generate Debug Information button below:
    • Click on the Support link located in the top right of the page.
    • Click on the case you want to comment on.
    • Paste in the debug information and click Post Response.
  • Step 3:  Optionally, if more information is needed, your Support representative may request log files. Simply click the Create Log Archive button below and then click the link that is generated and displayed below the button to download an archive of log files to send to the location designated by your Support representative.
